choices: A character from Dragon Ball Z
1.content:
Your name is Evan and you hate anime. You think it's stupid and has no meaning. The only anime you'll watch is Pokemon. But your sister loves it. Your sister, Melody, always goes to those stupid conventions and dresses up like a character. You think it's really dumb. But then one day you say something wrong about it. Lets recap shall we?

"Mel, why do you insist on dressing up for that stupid convention" Evan said.

"Because it's fun, you should try it" Melody said.

"I think it's stupid and I would hate it" Evan said.

"Well, you like Pokemon, maybe a character from that, tell you what, come to the con tomorrow and I will be able to convince you" Melody said.

"Yeah, I'll bet you can!" Evan said smugly.

"Okay then since you are so sure you won't be convinced.."

"What?

"Lets make a wager. If I can convince you I get to choose your costume"

"Fine! There's no way in hell you can convince me anyway!

However, in the end, she did. Being a 15 year old boy with raging hormones and the scantily clad girls convinced you that maybe the con wasn't that bad. So in the end she won. You are now sitting in her room waiting for her to unveil your costume.

"Hurry it up Mel! I want this over and done with now!" Evan said

"I'm just getting the final parts together!" Mel screams from the other room.

She walks back in with something behind her back. She pulls the costume out. It is...
1.title: It begins....

11.content:
"A Misty costume?" Evan said surprised. He did like Misty, but didn't want to be her!

"Yep, I figure you like Pokemon, Ash has dressed like a girl, why not you?

"Well, I guess I did make the bet..."

"Great!" She exclaims whisking you to her vanity and putting you in a chair. "Now, even though Misty is tomboyish, she does need to look like a girl." She takes your hands and starts to file your nails, making them neater and then putting on a coat of clear nail polish. "Just to make sure they don't chip" Then she starts to take the misty wig out and started to brush it. While she did that you sat there, thinking how far she would take this. About 20 minutes after when she finished she rushed you into the shower and had you rub a special cream on your arms and legs that got rid of all your body hair. Then you got out and walked back to the chair and she handed you a bra and panties. The bra was a poke ball bra and the panties were togepi panties. You almost laughed at the irony. Then she turned around while you put them on. Next she gave you the tank top, then the shorts, then the suspenders and finally fit the wig on you. Then she did your makeup, by making you look slightly girly, though your face had always looked slightly girly.

What's next?
11.title: A Misty Cosplay costume

111.content:
You and your sister get in her car and your mind is running laps thinking about what can happen to you dressed like this. Your sister however is as happy and bubbly as ever. She is dressed like Sakura from Naruto. She pulls up to the con and she drags you over to a group of girls. You recognize them as your sister's friends, all dressed in assorted costumes, some of which you can't tell. You see Kelly, your sister's best friend, Veronica, another of your sister's friends and Rebecca, you have had a crush on Rebecca since you were little but you were always afraid to tell her.

"Hey Mel! Hey, uh who is this?" Kelly says.

"Oh my god..." Veronica says.

"Evan, is that you?" Rebecca says.

They start laughing but then stop when they see you blushing.

"Oh we're sorry, it's just that we didn't expect this" Kelly says.

"Yeah, come on lets go enjoy the con!" Veronica says.

You all start to walk in and show your passes. You pass many booths when Rebecca pulls you aside to talk with you.

"I don't want to sound mean, but why the hell are you dressed like this?"

"I made a bet with Mel. I thought I'd win"

"Funny, never make a bet with your sister. No one ever wins those. But I do like that you took it like a man and went along with it. That's real manliness, being able to show your feminine side!" she says.

She gives you a hug and you start to walk with the group again. Your sister seems to be having fun, maybe this isn't so bad...

Whats next?
111.title: To the Con as Misty!

1111.content:
You walk around when your sister literally yanks you away from a display you were looking at and points to a sign.

"Look! A costume contest! We should enter!" she says.

"I don't know..." you say.

"Oh come on! I'll go too if you go Evan" Rebecca says.

Do you go?
1111.title: Costume contest?

11111.content:
"Ok, I guess." you say as your sister drags you up to the registration booth..

"Okay, we all want to enter the contest" your sister says.

"Sure, go stand over there and wait" the woman at the booth says handing you all a piece of paper with a number on it.

You walk over to a line with a bunch of other people in the line.

"Nice costume" a guy dressed as Squall from Final Fantasy VIII says to you.

"Thanks, you too" you say.

"So, what's your name?" he asks.

"My name is..." you can't let him know you're a guy! "Eva"

"That's a beautiful name. Mine is Lance"

"Cool name" you say when you hear an announcer's voice.

"Time for the costume contest! Will numbers 1-15 walk onto the stage" he says.

You glance at your number. You are number 29, so you won't be up for a while.

"Well, I gotta go up there" Lance says as he walks away.

"Bye" you say.

"Hey Evan! What's going on" Melody says.

"Shh, call me Eva, I don't want people to know I'm a guy"

"Oh, good idea bro! Saw you talking to Squall, gonna go on a date with him?" she says jokingly.

"No!" you say, your face turning red.

"Relax I was kidding"

"Will numbers 16-31 walk onto the stage?" the guy says again.

"Come on Eva!" Melody says pulling you onto the stage.
11111.title: Yes

choices: You spot someone you know from school
111111.content:
"And next we have a great Majjin Buu cosplay!" the announcer says as a guy dressed as Buu from Dragon Ball Z walks onto the stage. You're next. Time to suck it up and enjoy yourself.

"And next we have a Misty cosplay!" the announcer says as you walk onto stage, waving to the crowd and making an angry face, like Misty did when Brock hit on women. You walk off and are met by Lance.

"Hey! You did great!" Lance says

"Yeah. You too!" you say.

"So, do you want to go look around the floor with me?" Lance asks.

"Let me ask my sister, I'm here with her." You say as your sister walks off stage and you run to her.

"Lance wants me to go around the show floor with him! What do I do?" you ask her.

"Why not? You need to loosen up." she says.

"Okay." you say and walk back over. "She said I could!"

"Cool, lets go!" Lance says as he leads you out to the show floor.

You walk around for a bit and then...
111111.title: The contest begins

choices: Tell him that you're a guy
Tell him you have a boyfriend
1111111.content:
You walk around a bit more when Lance takes your hand. You're unsure how to feel about that so you just hold his hand. Then he pulls you in and starts to kiss you. Now this time, you really don't know how to feel. You pull away from his face.

"Oh sorry Eva, I didn't know that would make you uncomfortable" he says

"Um, that's okay" you say

"Whatever, let's go over there" he says pointing to a setup of chairs for people to sit in.

"Yeah, but I have to use the little girl's room first"

"Oh, sure"

You walk into the women's bathroom and see costumes, much more elaborate than your's on the floor as their wearers use the facilities. Then standing at the sink, you see Rebecca and Melody.

"Hey Mel" you say.

"Oh hey Eva" Melody says.

You tell her everything that just happened.

"And then I came in here to think" you say

"Well, looks like he really likes you" Melody says.

"Yeah, but I think he might not like what's under the costume" Rebecca says.

"Yeah, so what do I do?"
1111111.title: Lance tries to kiss you

choices: You spill something on the costume
11111112.content:
To avoid embarrassing the both of you, you decide to tell him that you have a boyfriend. You say goodbye to Mel and Rebecca and return to Lance.

"Hey Lance, listen..." you begin to say.

"No, you listen, I shouldn't have tried to kiss you, that was a stupid thing of me to do. You probably have a boyfriend right?" he says.

"Yeah, but you didn't know, it's not that bad" you say trying to comfort him.

"So, what do you want to do now? The con isn't over for like 10 hours..."

"We can go get something to eat if you're hungry"

"Good idea, I know a great restaurant like a block from here"

"Cool, let me text my sister, don't want her worrying" you say pulling out your phone and texting Melody, "Hey, me and Lance are going to get something to eat, we'll be back soon"

"Shall we go milady?" Lance says jokingly.

"We shall"
11111112.title: Tell him you have a boyfriend

choices: A pair of jeans and a tee shirt
111111122.content:
You go into the restaurant and go to sit down. Lance pulls out your chair and you sit. There are a lot of other people dressed in cosplay there, and one guy with an extra bulky costume.

"I'll go get drinks" Lance says and he walks away.

Your phone goes off and Melody has texted back. It says "Cool, we're on our way over there to eat too. See ya there!" Just as you put your phone away Lance returns and puts down a two closed bottle of Coke.

"So, what do you want to talk about?" Lance asks as you both open the bottles and put them on the table.

"I don't know-oh!" you scream as the guy with the bulky costume bumps your table and your drink splashes all over the costume. You jump out of your seat and your hear someone yell "Eva!" You turn around and see Melody and her gang walk up.

"Eva are you okay?" Mel says.

"Yeah, but the costumes a bit wet... and sticky"

"I have a spare outfit in the car! I sort of assumed that I would be the one to spill something" Rebecca says.

"Can you go get it? I'll be in the bathroom" you say

"Sure!" Rebecca says.

You go your separate ways and you wait in a stall in the women's bathroom. After a few minutes you hear a knock on the door.

"Hey Ev, I got the outtfit" Rebecca says handing it to you.

"Oh cool, what is it?" you ask looking at it.
111111122.title: You spill something on the costume

choices: You and Lance go back to the Con
1111111221.content:
You look down and see a pair of skinny jeans and a lime green tee shirt.

"Sorry, Eva it's the only spare outfit I have with me" Rebecca says.

"No it's fine. It could be way worse." you say pulling the jeans on. The jeans are kind of tight, but you pull them on. The only problem is that it flattened out your crotch even more, which was uncomfortable. The shirt is fine, a bit loose in the chest, but that's to be expected from a girl's shirt. Then you walk out of the stall still in the wig. You assume that Lance would find it weird that you are still in the wig, so you walk out the door and call Melody in.

"Hey Mel, can you help me with something?" you ask to her, who was right outside the door.

"Sure Ev, what do you need?"

"If I keep wearing the wig, don't you think it would be weird? Since I don't have the costume anymore?"

"Good idea, thank god you decided to not get a haircut last week. I can work with this" she says taking off the wig and starting to brush your hair. She shows you in the mirror what she came up with and you see yourself, if you were a girl. Sort of like a mix of you and Mel, since you both got most of your features from your mom.

"Wow, it looks good" you say.

"Yep, and I think it might be a good idea to touch up the makeup, just to be sure"

"Probably" you say as she adds some darker makeup to your face. It's not that much different but you do look a lot girlier.

"Okay, let's go back out there"
1111111221.title: A pair of jeans and a tee shirt

11111112211.content:
You, Lance, Mel and Rebecca leave the restaurant to return to the convention center. You feel better, since your legs are covered better than they were with the shorts.

"So Eva, what do you want to do now?" Lance asks you.

"I don't know. What is there to do?" you reply.

"Well, they are having a " Mel says getting cut off by Rebecca elbowing her in the chest.

"Well, look who we have here" you hear a familiar voice say.

"Hello Jerry. Fancy meeting you here." Mel says.

Jerry was her ex boyfriend. They broke up on a bad note and he had taken out a lot of the anger on bullying people that were into anime, so what he was doing here was beyond your guess. He turned to see you with Lance. You really hoped he didn't recognize you.
11111112211.title: You and Lance go back to the Con

choices: Yes, and it's a bad one.
111111122111.content:
"Well, who's this lovely lady?" Jerry says. You're relieved that he doesn't recognize you.

"That's my cousin, Eva!" Rebecca says. Phew, she saved you from questions about why Mel never mentioned a cousin.

"Well, hello Eva are you single?" Jerry says. Jeez, he's a jerk.

"No. I have a boyfriend." you reply shyly.

"Well, I assume he isn't here, this guy doesn't look like boyfriend material" he says pointing to Lance.

"But he is!" you say, hoping he'll leave you alone that way.

"Uh, yeah! That's right! Stay away from my girl!" Lance says trying to be physically imposing on Jerry who is almost twice his size.

"Don't touch me nerd!" Jerry says and he looks mad.

Does Jerry start a fight with Lance?
111111122111.title: He doesn't recognize you

1111111221112.content:
"Hmph! Nerds! Whatever." Jerry says walking away.

"Phew, that was a close one." Mel says.

"Yeah he could get really dangerous during fights." Rebecca says.

"I could have taken him!" Lance says.

"No you couldn't, Jerry is really violent. He once put a guy from school through a cafeteria table." Kelly says.

You start to walk around the con some more. You hear announced on the loudspeaker that there is going to be a video game tournament later on, so you decide to check that out.
1111111221112.title: No, he walks away.

11111112211121.content:
You walk toward the video game tournament and see the registration table. You register and walk to the table with the controllers. The game in the tournament is one that you're really good at. Lance, you, and your sister are playing and you finish the tournament and go to another booth.

"You are really good at that game Eva, I've never met a girl that's so good at video games!" Lance says.

"Thanks Lance." you say blushing.

"Well, what do you want to do next?" Melody asks.
11111112211121.title: Video Game Tournament

111111122111211.content:
Jerry walks back up to your and the group, and Mel stands in front, ready to confront him.

"Stand back, Melody, I'm not here for you. I'm here for Mr. Boyfriend Material." Jerry said.

"Oh no you don't!" Lance says, holding his gunblade up.

"That's not a real weapon! It's a piece of wood!" Jerry shouted.

"Maybe so, but I can still do this!" Lance says, ramming the gunblade into Jerry's crotch.

"AUGH!" Jerry shouted, falling to the ground.

"Run!" Rebecca shouted, and you run away. Thank god you didn't have heels on.

You turn a corner and regroup, as you sit down on the floor.

"Lance! That was nuts!" you shouted.

"Yeah..." Lance said.

"Anyway, it might not be safe to stay here..." Mel said.

"Yeah..." you said.

"But what if Jerry goes after Lance?" Rebecca said.

"Good point, Lance, where do you live?" Mel asked.

"I'm from out of state, I drove up here for the con. I'm staying at the hotel." he said.

"Okay, someone might want to stay with him, at least for the night, in case Jerry comes." Mel said.

"Can Eva do it?" Lance asked.

"Uh, sure." you replied.

"Okay, when we come back tomorrow we'll bring you some clothes." Mel said.

Now what?
111111122111211.title: Jerry comes back.

1111111221112111.content:
You sit on the couch in Lance's hotel room as he walks out of the bathroom in his regular clothes.

"So, even though nothing will happen, since you have a boyfriend and all, but can I tell my friends that I spent the night with a girl in my hotel room?" Lance asked.

"Sure," you said laughing, since after the con, Eva won't exist anymore anyway.

"You're really cool, you know that?" he asked.

"So are you." you replied.

"Thanks, Eva." Lance said.

"Anyway, we should get to sleep, one more day of the convention tomorrow!"

"Yeah,"
1111111221112111.title: Later that night...

11111112211121111.content:
You awake to a knock on the door. You hear the shower running and stumble to the door in a half asleep haze. You look through the peephole to see Melody and Rebecca. You open the door.

"Good morning, sunshine!" Melody said.

"Mornin' to you too." you said.

"Anyway, we got a bunch of stuff for you to go through for clothes since we figure we should give you a choice." Rebecca said, putting the bag she was holding down.

"Let's get to work." Melody said, opening the bag.

You rifle through the bag and look everything over. You take two outfits out and lay them on the bed. You decide to throw caution to the wind and pick a skirt for one of the outfits. You decide that the two choices will be, an outfit consisting of a light blue tank top, and a pair of jeans, and a superhero graphic babydoll tee and a black skirt.

"I also have these if you go with the skirt." Melody said taking out a pair of black open toed 1/2 inch heels.

"Hmmm" you started.
11111112211121111.title: The next morning...

choices: Fine, you can do my nails.
No, let's just get the outfit together.
111111122111211112.content:
You sigh, and pick up the skirt.

"Why not?" you asked.

"Good choice." Melody said.

You walk to an area of the room that is blocked off from the rest of the room with the two girls and you get dressed, putting on new panties and a new bra, sliding the skirt up your shaved legs and putting the shirt on.

"Hmmm" Melody said.

"What?" you asked.

"It's just, if you're going to wear the open toed shoes, your toenails look terrible." Melody replied.

"They're fine."

"Are they, though?"

"Hmmmm" you start.
111111122111211112.title: Babydoll tee, skirt and heels.

choices: You run back into Jerry (and a security guard)
You get to the con without incident
1111111221112111121.content:
"Please?" Rebecca asked.

"Fine..." you said.

"Great! We'll clean up your fingernails too!" Melody said.

"Okay." you said, you were already pretty deep in being a temporary girl, might as well go all the way.

Melody sits you down at a table and takes your hands and starts filing the nails like she had done the previous day. But this time, she adds a french manicure, and you marvel at how feminine your hands look with it.

Rebecca started on your toenails and filed them, and then polished them with a clear coat. She smiles at you as she finished up and you slip the heels on. After learning how to walk in them, Lance walks out of the bathroom once again dressed as Squall Leonhart.

"You sure about going out in the same costume? What about Jerry?" you asked.

"There's gotta be like fifty Squalls there, besides it's the only costume I bought." Lance said.

"Okay, let's get going then." Melody said.

"You look very pretty today, Eva." Lance said.

"Thanks..." you said blushing.

You start to walk back to the convention center.
1111111221112111121.title: Fine, you can do my nails.

11111112211121111211.content:
You walk up to the convention and as you walk toward the door Jerry and a large man with a jacket with an insignia of the convention center walk up to you.

"Is there a problem?" Melody asked.

"Yes, this man, if you can call him one, assaulted me yesterday." Jerry said to the guard.

"We're going to have to revoke his pass," the guard said.

"And all of theirs, and ban them!" Jerry shouted.

"Did they assault you?" the guard asked.

"No, but they let him do it!" Jerry said.

"Listen, we wouldn't have to if he wasn't stalking us." Melody said.

"Stalking?" the guard asked.

"He was harrassing Eva here, and even came back after he was told that she wasn't interested.

"Hmm..." the guard muses.
11111112211121111211.title: You run back into Jerry (and a security guard)

choices: No, it's not fair to Lance.
111111122111211112111.content:
"You believe them?" Jerry asked.

"Their story is more plausible, but I'm going to have to revoke your pass, and the boy's pass." the guard said.

"Sorry, Lance." you said, grabbing his arm.

"Fine! I didn't want to go in anyway!" Jerry shouted, walking away.

"You guys can go inside without me..." Lance said.

"Hmm..." you think.
111111122111211112111.title: Jerry gets kicked out

choices: Okay, let's sneak me back in.
1111111221112111121111.content:
"Come on, Mel. It's not fair to Lance!" you plead.

"Fine, but what else can we do?" Melody concedes.

"Well, we do have an extra pass, since Veronica has a family thing today..." Kelly starts.

"No way, he'll never do it." you said.

"Do what?" Lance asked.

"We can sneak you back in, but you'd have to be dressed like a girl..." you said.

"What? That's ridiculous!" Lance shouts.

"It was just a thought..." Kelly said.

"Well..." Lance starts.
1111111221112111121111.title: No, it's not fair to Lance.

11111112211121111211111.content:
Wait, really?" you asked.

"I came all this way for the con, only to miss the last day?" Lance said.

"Fair enough. Back to the hotel!" Kelly said.

"So, what type of girl do you want to be?" Melody asked.

"I don't know!" Lance said.

"Hmm... Tomboy or girly girl?" Rebecca asked.
11111112211121111211111.title: Okay, let's sneak me back in.

111111122111211112111112.content: "Well you can either choose costume or normal clothes. If it's costume, the only extra one we have that would fit you is a Serena costume from pokemon. Or we have a cute dress you can wear. Which one do you want?"
111111122111211112111112.title: Girly Girl

1111111221112111121111121.content:
"I guess I'll take the Pokemon costume." Lance said.

"Great!" Melody said.

"Why do I have to dress like a girl again?" Lance asked.

"Because the guard knows what you look like, and also the pass is registered to Veronica. If they scan it, they're expecting to see a girl." Melody said.

"Ah." Lance said.

You made your way back to the hotel room and Melody unpacked the costume and handed it to Lance.

"Put it on." she said.

Lance put the costume on, including the brown wig and hat.

"We just need to do your face." Rebecca said, taking out a makeup kit.

Lance sat quietly and let Rebecca put makeup on him, before Melody put a mirror in front of his face.

"For today, you are Veronica. Unless of course you have a better name?" Melody asked.

"Veronica's fine." Lance said.

"Back to the con?" you asked.
1111111221112111121111121.title: Serena

11111112211121111211111212.content:
You start to think maybe you should tell Lance that you are also a boy considering he also is now dressed as a girl as well.
Do you do it?(Please continue this)
11111112211121111211111212.title: Does the truth come out?

111111122111211112111112121.content:
Keenly observant of Lance now, you couldn't help but feel more than a little anxious; inwardly, a battle raged between two dragons. One, of the opinion you needed to tell your secret now, out in the open. Leaving him no longer within the dark, and spilling it out so that a future kiss would no longer be nearly so likely. The other dragon was of the opposite opinion, positing that, while such a thing could be beneficial in the short term, such brutal honesty might be best eased into. Amidst such thoughts, however, the world continued to turn around you, various folks in costumes were rather insistent in brushing past you and your friends and farther into the convention floor. Some turned into the vendor room, stacked wall to wall with vendors of various goods, others going to the entrance or even into the Artists' Alley.

Wherever they were going, it hardly mattered; what truly caught hold was Lance, dressed in his girly costume, gently nudging you with an elbow and speaking. "Hey, Eva? You alright?" A quick glance over and your stomach churned, seeing the genuine look of concern on his face. It was insanely difficult now to just..spill the beans out, letting and getting everything in the open. Thoughts wracked in your brain, fighting for the right to be heard. Instead of speaking, you give him a nod and that seems to assure him, for the most part.

Lance goes back to discussing various topics with the others in tow, laughing and chuckling at a few apt jokes, and otherwise having a splendid time. Somehow, they made it even harder. Gently drumming your fingers on a hip, the convention itself seemed of less concern, more and more, your thoughts zeroed in on this one, difficult proposition. Was there another answer, another way? If so, there wasn't much forthcoming your way. How can I break it to him?

Just a simple, questioned thought, but still so difficult to answer. You couldn't do it publicly; besides the embarrassment, there was no telling just how he'd react. And then, a sudden interruption of your thoughts came into vision, as a hand held in front collided with your face, eliciting a 'Ouch!' from your lips.

"Hey!" The familiar voice of your sister, Mel, rang inside of your eardrums, "Aren't you paying the least bit of attention, Eva? I asked you a question!"

"Oh," you uttered, "sorry. I spaced out."

"No kidding!" Mel exclaimed; the others laughed and tittered, grins popping up on their faces, "so, like I asked; what did you want to do?"

"Uh...well, I dunno. What're you gonna do?" you asked, looking at her curiously.

"I'm gonna head back to the room for now," she said.

"So are we!" The girls with her chimed in.

"I'm gonna look around some more. You're welcome to come with me, if you'd like." Lance flashed a smile your way, and it had the opposite effect; instead of washing away all your troubles and soothing your soul, it only made things difficult.

"Oh...well, uhm. I was going to look around the vendor room some more, maybe..." you answered, and to your dismay Lance's face seemed to light up; the girls' did as well.

"Great!" Lance exclaimed, "if you'd like, you can come with me." The girls tittered and watched, interest sketched on their faces as to your answer.

"Uh...." It took a moment for you to answer, as your eyes danced around the group before you nodded, "sure." And, just like that, a great dispersal; the girls made their goodbyes, Mel and Rebecca giving a wink to you before leaving while Lance's smile remained.

"Come on then; to the Vendor room!" He declared, and you nodded and followed along, keeping in step with the boy. Yet still, it bothered you that spilling the beans wasn't coming out so easily; it was..hard. Just being keenly aware of him, watching him all smiles and laughter. The resolve came later on, after buying a few choice items of your own -- figurines of Misty, Ash and the gang, as well as some unknown anime figurines, an Japanese-lettered storyboard book on Ghost in the Shell, and volume 1 of Kaze Hikaru -- before you finally decided to spill it all out.

"Lance," you started to say, the white bags of figurines and books swaying gently as you walked, "uhm...I need to talk. You know...importanty stuff."

A laugh came from his throat, "Importanty stuff?" that sent a blush to your cheeks.

"I'm serious!" you protested, a light pout on your lips. Before he formed a proper response, however, he seemed to take more interest in the various cosplays on display; A decent Kenshin Himura, a more-than-acceptable 11th Doctor, Deadpool and a very well-made Maka Albarn costume, complete with a great Soul by her side.

After taking pictures and otherwise getting things on camera, you eventually pulled his attention away enough to get him focused. "It's really important!"

"Alright, alright. What do you wanna talk about?" he asked, a curious expression on his face.

"Not here," you said, quickly surveying the area, "somewhere a bit more private?" His face took on an even more intriqued expression and he gave a nod.

"Sure. Uh..I think there are a few empty rooms around here. I know of one..." he said, and you nodded.

"That works!" And then, after a serious of long hallways and ccorridors bursting with activity and people, the two came upon several sets of double doors, colorfully marked, as well as more gray and blandly marked one's. Lance eventually decided upon a relatively unoccupied one, and the two stepped within. It was a rather dark area, aside from the projection displayed on the far north wall, though it only showed, well...a white screen.

"So, what did you want to talk to me about?"

"Well..." Finding that courage, held deep within the pit of your stomach, you began, "I have a..confession to make." When his face took on an expressed interest, you felt emboldened and continued on.

"I'm...uhm...I'm not really..."

A laugh. "You're not really Misty? I couldn't have guessed!" When that didn't elicit any laughter from you, his expression soured and a hand grazed the back of his head, gently rubbing it. "Sorry..guess it wasn't as funny as I thought it'd be."

If the situation and subject matter weren't so serious, you really would've been thankful for the brevity. Alas..."Look, okay, I'm...uh..." He leaned in, paying every bit of attention to you as anyone possibly could.

For several moments after, you were silent, and such silence remained unbroken until he let out a cough. "You're...?"

"I'm Evan!" You blurted out, "I'mnotreallyeva!"

The response from him seemed shocking. His face flashed an.....
111111122111211112111112121.title: Tell him the truth

1111111221112111121111121212.content:
Your limited experience with anime provided a rather lackluster set of expectations; hell, perhaps expecting such things to result in similar circumstances and similar outcomes was naive. Regardless, when you saw the look on his face, your breath hitchedi n your throat. His hands clenched tightly, enough that the knuckles whitened. Even in the most feminine, he clearly looked angry, and for a moment, hurt. Without saying a word, he caused you to flinch slightly and dread the words to come.

The deafening silence was, perhaps worse. It only amped up your anxiety, fingers curling and clenching tighter around the handles of your purchases. Only the sound of the running projected seemed to reverberate about the room, its' gears whirring and gently pervading the air. At least, until Lance finally spoke.

"His head made several half-movements, a hand outstretched and finger extended to point at you. Several times it shook, mouth parting and pursing without a word, before finally a sound; the sound of a frustrated grunt. "You're Evan, huh?" he said, in a fairly unkind voice. You could only nod slightly.

Then, he laughed mirthlessly, shaking his head. "Why didn't you say this earlier? You know, when I stood up for you against Jerry? Or..I dunno...anytime?"

"I...I dunno..." you responded timidly, and he laughed again.

"You dunno? Or maybe you just wanted to trick me. Haha..all one big, fat trick on Lance! Get him to kiss the girl and then reveal; tada! It's actually a boy!" In the best impression of a stage performer, the boy pantomimed and made exaggerated motions, the end of which had him outstretching his arms and curling his lips into a big smile.

"Or maybe you wanted to catch me on candid camera!" And this continued mockery had him mock-holding a camera, peering at Evan through a fake lens, "get Lance on camera kissing a girl that's not a girl! Maybe a little blackmail, eh?"

"It's not like that!" you protested, but his only response was another sharp laugh, an act that made you flinch in response and step back a bit.

"Oh? It isn't, Evan? Maybe your sister just wanted to get a few extra bucks outta me, eh? Even better! Get the idiot in drag, extra blackmail!" A frustrated sigh later, and you held back biting commentary. It was better to be placating here, instead of confrontational.

"No! No. It wasn't her; Mel had nothing to do with this," you spoke out, "I'm...I'm the only one apart of this, okay?" His posture returned to normal, though his expression retained the anger.

"Just you?" he asked, peering over at you. You gave a firm nod.

"Hah. Great..great trick you played on me. Really good. Once in a lifetime!" he spoke, laughing -- though, discerning the raucous enjoyment within it would be impossible. That required enjoyment of some kind.

"What's the matter? Got nothing else to say?" He asked; when you offered nothing but silence and pursed lips, his expression soured considerably.

"Fine by me!" He said, and stepped forward menacingly. You stepped back in retaliation, an act that further spurred him on, until you hit a wall.

"What are you--"

"What am I doing?" he asked, standing between you and freedom, "just playing a little prank." He leaned in, close to your face, "after all, you like pranks, don't you? You like toying with hearts, too."

"No, I don't--"

"Shut up," he said, and you flinched. Minutes passed, and no action on his part. Until he breathed a sigh, and stepped away, turning on the balls of his heels.

"I'm going. Maybe I'll see your sister on the way out, but whatever. Have a nice one."

"Wait, Lance, I'm..." And, just like that, he was gone; the sound of a door opening and closing indicating his departure, "...sorry." Then, there was nothing but the broken projector to keep you company. Instead of departing straight out, however, you went to an empty seat and sat, your head swimming with thoughts and emotions. This wasn't like you were used to, being so readily brushed away and it..well. Strangely, it hurt. A lot. A knot had formed inside of your thumping chest, and fresh tears had welled within both eyes.

The grip on your items loosened, until they fell to the red carpeted floor, gently gathering at your feet in a pile. And, for the next hour, that was all that happened. That was, until...
1111111221112111121111121212.title: He was angry.

11111112211121111211111212121.content:
You walked out of the convention center, staring straight the whole time. You walked into the hotel and went up to Lance's room. You knocked on the door, there was no answer. You knocked again.

"Lance!" you shouted.

The door opened and Lance, now out of the costume glared at you.

"Here's your stuff." he said, dropping it onto the floor in front of the door. He went to close it, but you stuck your foot in front of the door.

"We need to talk." you said.

"I'm done talking." Lance said.

"I'm not." you said. "You said your piece. Now let me say mine."

"Why should I? After you led me on for a whole day?"

"Please."

"...Fine." Lance said, allowing you to walk into the room.

"This wasn't supposed to happen this way. It was a goof, a stupid joke on Mel's part." you said.

"You said she wasn't involved."

"She wasn't, in this part. But she's the reason I was here. She made a bet, because I told her I'd never enjoy myself at one of these cons, so she bet that if I went one day and enjoyed myself, I'd have to go the rest of the weekend dressed in costume, of her choosing." you said. "Then she made me enter the costume contest. And if you remember, you talked to me first. Complimenting my costume."

"Uh huh."

"I wanted to tell you, I almost did, when I made up the boyfriend lie. But I was too embarrassed."

"How the hell do you think I felt?"

"I... I don't know. All I want to say is, I'm sorry. It went too far and I apologize. I just hope we can become friends again."

He stared at you silently.

"Friends?" you asked.

What is his response?
11111112211121111211111212121.title: ....you left.

111111122111211112111112121212.content:
"friends you want to be friends!"
lance yells
then
111111122111211112111112121212.title: Not friends.

1111111221112111121111121212122.content:
"You embarrass me, you lead me on, and you want to be friends?"

"Lance..." you started.

"What? You're sorry? You want to make things right?"

"Well..."

"No, go on! I want to know what you wanted to say."

"I thought you were different. That you were nice. You're no better than..."

"No better than who?"

"No better than Jerry. A jackass who just wants to hurt people for the sake of hurting people."

"No better than Jerry? Would Jerry do this?"

Lance grabbed you and pulled you closer and kissed you. You felt his tongue moving around in your mouth and you tried to push Lance away. You push him back and run towards the bathroom and lock the door from the inside.

You start to cry, and lay on the floor. You don't know how long you're down there when you hear a knock on the door.

"Who is it?"

"It's..."
1111111221112111121111121212122.title: he kisses you

11111112211121111211111212121221.content:
The last name you were desirous to hear, especially after what he'd done earlier. Instinctively, you'd spoken out, "Go away!" before you had even thought of what to say. The rapping of his knuckles against the locked door continued, seemingly unfazed by your quick rejection, this time harder and louder. You'd hoped this would alert some authority figure -- a guard, like earlier who'd come and check to see what the problem was, or perhaps a nice con-goer, hearing an obvious disagreement.

It was little more than a dream, sitting on the cold, hard checkered floor of the bathroom. Well-furnished and well-maintained, you had no worries about how clean your clothes would be after getting up off of this floor. There would still be dirt and other nasty little things to cling to your clothes, but at least the possibilities would be limitedi n scope. But, such as it was, Lance would not let you dig yourself deep into a reverie of your surroundings or go too deeply into your mind to get away from this situation and pretend it wasn't happening.

No, it seemed, he was determined and adamant to be heard. "Look," he began, "just..let me in, okay? I promise I won't-"

"Go away!" you shouted again, your eyes momentarily lifted to the door in question. It occasionally rattled from the force of blows hit upon it, insistent as Lance was, but thankfully it didn't budge or move much, too resistant to allow him in. Lance, from where you sat, could easily be head breathing a frustrated, perhaps angry sigh, followed up by another noisy bang against the door. Thankfully, his knocks seemed ot stop altogether, and footsteps could be heard echoing, going away from it. Whew...one disaster averted!

Now, as you sat here on the bathroom floor, your mind started to drift towards what'd happen just moments ago. Your head half-shook, mouth twitching. It wasn't something you expected from Lance. Was he really that angered by the comparison to Jerry? Hell, in your opinion now, he was fast approaching 'worse than Jerry' tier.

At the very least, you never recalled Jerry forcing himself on someone like that; sure, he'd often forced himself near people, pushed them around, verbally abused you and Mel a lot after the break-up..but he never really closed the distance and kissed Mel when she didn't want to be kissed. At least, to your knowledge.

Maybe it was something worth discussing with Mel, after this whole trip was over with. Even without that, he was still just as bad, and you'd felt..scared. Your heart had been beating, up until now, rather rapidly with adrenaline pumping through to every pore and every vein, but that adrenaline high was coming down now. You were hardly calmer, or felt safer, but at least Lance was gone. For now, anyways. What'd made him turn so against you, anyways? Was it really just the revelation? Wasn't it normal for some guys to dress up as girls at these conventions?

You hardly seemed like an exception, yet he seemed so angry and hurt and...everything. Gently brushing a single tile on the checkered floor, you'd lightly tap it a few times, thoughts racing about this whole mess. Would it be wise to go ahead and risk going out? Or..what? Stay here, wait a little while longer before attempting it?

....what if Lance was out there? Just..waiting? For all you knew, he could be. You certainly thought he'd left, and there were no more footsteps outside of the door, no more discernible, human sounds beyond it. Yet, deep in the back of your mind, you could not help but entertain the possibility, a possibility that rapidly asserted itself in the forefront of your thoughts.

Should you go out and risk it, or..wait a little while longer?
11111112211121111211111212121221.title: "....me, Lance."

111111122111211112111112121212211.content:
You sat there and weighed the options, you can stay here, and maybe he won't come back, but since you were in the bathroom of his hotel room, that was very unlikely. You really had no choice. You stood up and walked to the door. You unlocked it and jumped back. The door didn't move. You grabbed the doorknob and slowly turned it, and opened the door. You peered outside and looked from left to right, not seeing Lance.

"Must've gone for a walk." you said. "It's about time I did that too."

You picked up the pile of clothes he had dropped at your feet earlier, and opened the door to the hotel room and started to walk down the hallway.

"Where should I go now?" you asked yourself.
111111122111211112111112121212211.title: Heavy risk, but the prize...

1111111221112111121111121212122111.content:
For a moment, once you were out in the safe hallways of the hotel, you'd quite thought about pursuing Lance. Perhaps to get an explanation, perhaps some answers or closure or... or something approaching reasonable discourse. That, however, would need to wait. There was no way you would confront him about it alone..or at least, fully alone. You'd need Melody and Rebecca nearby, just... just in case. You may be a man, but Lance was, or at least seemed to be, physically stronger than you.

If a confrontation happened, you didn't know the outcome, but weighing the likelihood of victory, you reluctantly concluded you would be a non-issue for Lance. This presented a problem, which was thankfully solved by the idea of numbers. Nearby numbers, a gang-up, some back-up..whatever to help, just in case. Would it come to a physical confrontation, or would it not? You'd no idea how the situation would be resolved, but..well, there was no use standing around here, just thinking about it.

Thus, you set off down the hallway, eyes peeled for any sign of Rebecca or Melody. You doubted they were around here, judging by their lack of presence, well... anywhere near here. Perhaps they'd gone back to the convention, or maybe went off to get a bite to eat? Both good possibilities, after all. Moving down a set of hallways, you eventually came upon an elevator, that went up or down, and pushed the button to call it. The call took a few minutes, then the sound of a soft ding entered your ears and the metal doors slid open to reveal an empty but polished metallic box. In you stepped, and pressed the door to the ground floor. It wasn't long after that you were out and about, looking for any sign of them.

For what, upon glancing at your watch was nearing an hour, you'd searched and searched the hotel and surrounding area and found nothing. It was a shame, but... unfortunately expected. As you headed out back towards the convention, just a few blocks away from the hotel, you'd caught a glimpse of a certain individual heading your way, though thankfully he lacked the appearance of Lance. No, instead it was... Jerry, a smile on his face.

"Hey," he greeted kindly, "what's a pretty lady like you doin' out here all alone? Need some company?"

"Shove off," you'd retort, lips twisting into a frown. Immediately, Jerry held up his hands in a defensive, open-palmed posture for a brief moment.

"No need to be so hostile!" he'd say, "anyways, you were at the con right? With uh..that nerd group or whatever, right?"

Suspicion entered your thoughts immediately, but you'd cautiously nod your head affirmatively.

"Seen Melody around anywhere?"

"No," you responded, "in fact, I've been looking for her."

"Great! Think we could go together an' find her?"
1111111221112111121111121212122111.title: Search for Mel and Rebecca

11111112211121111211111212121221112.content:
"... I guess." you said, feeling that he probably wouldn't take no for an answer anyway.

"Great!" Jerry said, and you both started to walk down the hallway. "So, I wasn't kidding before."

"What?"

"When I called you a lovely lady."

"...Thanks."

Jerry stopped walking and turned to you.

"You are quite a good looking girl, I really mean it. I don't know why you were hanging out with Melody..."

"Well..." you started. Jerry leaned into you and cornered you at the wall.

"Let's not ruin this moment by talking." Jerry said.

"Jerry, I'm going to keep looking for Melody." you said, trying to walk away, but he was keeping you from moving.

"Stop!" a voice said.

You and Jerry turned to see...
11111112211121111211111212121221112.title: "Yes."

111111122111211112111112121212211121.content:
You looked toward the source of the "Stop!" and saw Lance, his face contorted into anger.

"I might not really be her boyfriend, but I meant what I said, stay away from her." Lance said.

"And what are you going to do about it?"

"Oh he's not going to do anything. But I am." you said, and punched him in the face.

You ran to Lance, and you both started running down the corridor.

"Letting bygones be bygones?"

"More like defending someone in need. I'm still mad at you."

"Let's just get somewhere safe."

"Good idea,"

You run down the hallway and turn the corner and see...
111111122111211112111112121212211121.title: Lance

1111111221112111121111121212122111211.content:
Melody and Rebecca run up to you. You catch your breath and relax for a second before explaining your predicament.

"Lance knows, Jerry found me, I punched him in the face." you said, very quickly.

"You punched Lance in the face?" Melody asked.

"No, he punched Jerry in the face." Lance said.

"He?" Rebecca asked.

"Don't play dumb, he told me about the bet." Lance replied.

"Oh, good." Melody said.

"Not good. He's pretty angry that I led him on." you said.

"I think we might want to get out of here, Jerry could be coming any second." Lance said.

"Back to your room, then." Melody said.

Back in Lance's room, you and Lance recounted the tale of what had happened during the previous few hours.

"And yet we all still ended up together in here. Seems like Lance isn't as angry as he's putting on." Melody said.

"I am. Or at least I was, in the moment of it all. It seems silly now." Lance said.

"So, friends?" you asked.

"..." Lance started.
1111111221112111121111121212122111211.title: Melody and Rebecca

11111112211121111211111212121221112111.content:
"Friends... On one condition." Lance started.

"What do you want?" you asked.

"You owe me one Con day, since today was a bust." Lance said.

"That seems fair." Melody said.

"And I want a picture with Misty, so I can show it to my friends back home. They don't need to tell the whole story." Lance said.

"Do you still have the costume?" you asked Melody.

"Yeah, we washed it last night, but I figured I'd see if I could get you into the skirt." Melody replied. "It's in the car."

Fine, you get the picture and I'll get you a ticket to whatever convention you want, within reason." you said.

"Sounds good." Lance said.

Melody and Rebecca retrieved the costume from the car and you were once again Misty. You were actually thankful you got to wear sneakers instead of heels for a bit. You posed for a picture with Lance, in his Squall costume and he gave you his email so you could figure out the ticket situation later. You left Lance's room and started to head home, swearing to yourself that you'd never cosplay as a girl ever again. Whether or not you keep that promise... well that's a story for another day.
11111112211121111211111212121221112111.title: Friends

111111122111211112111112121212211121111.content:
It was almost a year later, and the convention was once again on the horizon. You weren't attending this year, and Mel didn't force you to, since after last year, she knew that you had a good reason for not wanting to go. Her and her friends however, were getting costumes together, this year planning to be the Sailor Scouts from Sailor Moon. They had jokingly asked you to be a part of it, as with only four of them, they were missing a Sailor Venus, but you had politely declined. Rebecca was a little bummed out, but she of course understood, after what happened last year, it was better to err on the side of caution. But, sometimes plans don't go as intended.

It was about two weeks before the convention when Lance contacted you. You reacted with shock at the email.

"You've got to be kidding me!" you shouted.

"What happened?" Mel asked as she poked her head into your room.

"Lance emailed me." you replied.

"Oh, does he want a ticket to a really expensive con?"

"Not exactly. Read it."

You moved aside so Mel could read the email. It read:

Hey Eva(n),

I know it's been a while, and I haven't taken you up on that offer for a con ticket. How about another way to pay the debt? So, that picture we took together, none of my friends bought that I actually knew you and figured you were some cosplay girl I took a picture with. That I could live with, but then... well... my friends are planning on going to this year's anime convention, and a girl in our group dropped out and we were planning on a group cosplay and... they want me to get you for it, to prove that I actually know you. We bought tickets in advance so that's covered and I can send the costume, you look like you're around the same size as the girl you'd be replacing. And if you aren't, you can get it altered. At least consider it. It'd be a big help, and make up for what happened last year. What do you say?

--
Lance

When she finished, she looked at you and started laughing.

"It's not funny! I can't do this!" you shouted.

"It's only for one weekend. You've already done it once!"

"And do you remember what happened? Jerry, and when Lance found out Eva didn't exist, it was terrible. I'm telling him no."

"Sleep on it, decide tomorrow."

"Fine, but I'm not changing my mind."

You spent the next few hours debating, weighing the options. He's in a bind, and it means you don't have to buy him a ticket, but it also means that you have to dress as a girl again, and around Lance's friends, who don't sound like the type of guys you want to be interacting with.

What do you decide?
111111122111211112111112121212211121111.title: Another Day

choices: A leather catsuit and a ginger wig. The group is cosplaying The Avengers
1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.content:
You woke up the next day and started drafting an email.

Hey Lance,

I wanted to say no, but I do owe you, and as much as I don't want to repeat the events of last year, I'll help you out. If the situation was reversed, I'd hope you'd do the same. But just this once. You can send the costume to me and I'm sure Mel can handle any adjustments.

--
Eva(n)

You heard laughing coming from behind you and saw that Mel had been reading over your shoulder.

"Shut up!" you said.

"No, I'm not laughing at you, I'm laughing because I get to give you another makeover." Mel said.

"Oh god. Now I'm not sure anymore." you said.

"Oh come on, don't deny that you had a little fun last time. And this time won't be so bad, since I won't be trying to embarrass you." Mel said.

"I wonder what their group is cosplaying as." you said.

"Guess you'll find out when the costume comes." Mel said.

A few days later, a package arrived at your doorstep from Lance. You hesitated as you began to open it, dreading what might be inside. You open the package and come face to face with...
1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.title: You'll do it

1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.content:
"You've got to be kidding me!" you shouted as you pulled out the catsuit and two black boots with a platform heel.

"Ooh, Avengers cosplay, not bad." Mel said.

"I thought it was an anime convention." you said.

"You can wear whatever cosplay, just be happy it's not something like Rikku from Final Fantasy. This isn't all that revealing." Mel said.

"Good point." you said. "Guess I should try it on."

"I have got to see this." she said.

You went to your room and stripped to your underwear. You pulled on the catsuit and zippered it to mid chest. Then you pulled on the boots, testing them a bit by walking around. You opened the door to your room and Mel walked in.

"Nice!" she said. "Good quality costume."

"It was definitely made for a bustier person." you said, motioning to the loose chest.

"We can fix that. I guess it's set. Can't wait to get you ready the day of the con."

"I can..." you laughed.
1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.title: A leather catsuit and a ginger wig. The group i...

1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.content:
The day of the convention arrived and you woke up, as Mel was rushing around to get her costume together. The doorbell rang and you answered it, finding Rebecca standing there, in costume with a bag.

"Hey Evan." she said. "I thought you gave up cosplay?"

"So did I." you said. "What's in the bag?"

"You'll see." Rebecca said as you let her into the house.

You walked together to Mel's room, as she set her costume out on her bed.

"Becky! You're here! I was so wrapped up I didn't here the door open," Mel said.

"It's fine. I've got the stuff you asked for." Rebecca said.

"Perfect. Well Evan, it's time for Eva to come out to play again." Mel said.

"Let's get it over with." you said.

"Okay first, go shower and shave your whole body." Mel said.

"What for? I'm wearing the catsuit! They won't see my legs or arms!" you protested.

"Remember last time? You weren't in costume the whole weekend. We have to be sure. There will be a lot more scrutiny from Lance's friends." Mel said.

"Fine." you said and walked into the bathroom to shower.

You emerged ten minutes later clean and hairless. You suddenly had flashbacks to the depilatory that you had used the previous year. You had a towel around your waist, and your hair, at Mel's insistence. You were immediately handed a pair of black panties, which you slipped on, out of view of the two girls. Then you walked back in and you were sat in the chair at Mel's vanity again. Mel started grooming your nails, cleaning them up as she had done the previous year. Though this year the clear nail polish dried with a bit of a pink tint. Rebecca also started shaping and polishing your toenails with pink nail polish.

"Is that necessary?" you asked.

"No, I just think it looks cute." Rebecca replied, smiling.

"What's next?" you asked, after the polish had dried.

"Well, last year we could suffice with stuffing the bra, but this year we need to upgrade." Mel said.

"So we got these." Rebecca said, pulling out two prosthetic breasts.

"Isn't that too far?" you asked.

"You're dressing up as Black Widow at an Anime convention as a favor to a guy you met as Misty last year. I think too far passed a while ago." Mel said.

"I guess I should just let this happen." you said.

"That's the spirit!" Rebecca said.

They glued the breasts to your chest and then Rebecca helped you into a bra, which was B-Cup they said. Then Mel started attaching hair extensions to your relatively short hair.

"I thought I was using a wig, and these are my normal hair color." you said.

"Well yeah, but after last year, if you need to take the costume off again, we don't need to be scrambling, plus your hair's shorter this year." Mel said.

"That seems fair." you said.

They braided your hair and put it under a wig cap, after which they put the short ginger wig on your head. The only thing left was makeup and actually putting on the costume. Mel and Rebecca didn't do that much makeup, but they softened your face and made you look more feminine, and then it was time. You suited up, pulling on the catsuit, boots, belt and glove and crossed your arms as you looked at Mel and Rebecca.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/236...

"How do I look?" you asked.

"Oh my god." Mel said. "You're stunning. I so need a picture of this. Hold that pose."

"You look great." Rebecca said. "Come on Mel, get in costume, can't keep the girls waiting. Plus we need to get Agent Romanoff back to her team."

What next?
1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.title: Getting ready for the convention

1111111221112111121111121212122111211111.content:
You sat in the car as Mel, dressed as Sailor Moon, drove towards the convention. You sat in the back of her car, along with Kelly, dressed as Sailor Mercury, and Veronica dressed as Sailor Mars sat on either side of you, while Rebecca sat shotgun, dressed as Sailor Jupiter. You held two toy guns, with orange tips, and fidgeted slightly, as you tried to get comfortable in the leather outfit.

"Man, I wish I could rock a catsuit like that." Kelly said.

"You look just like ScarJo too. Are you sure you weren't born a redhead? You seem predisposed to being one!" Veronica said.

"It's not like I have a choice." you said. "Last year it was Mel forcing me, and now it's my good nature."

"Well, you don't need to worry, no one is going to be able to know. Not even Lance's friends." Kelly said.

"I hope not. Lance couldn't even tell last year til I told him." you said.

"Well, we're here." Mel said.

You exited the car, and walked up to the convention hall. You looked around, and saw a man dressed as Ant Man waving at you. You squinted and realized, that it was Lance! You and Mel and her friends ran up to Lance, who was standing around with his friends, dressed as Iron Man, Captain America, The Hulk, Thor, Hawkeye, and The Wasp. You ran up to Lance and he smiled when he saw you up close. You nervously looked at his friends as they looked you up and down. The Wasp stepped forward.

"Wow! We didn't think you actually knew him." she said. "I'm Jillian, I'm Lance's Girlfriend."

"I'm Eva. But I guess Lance has told you all about me." you said. Then you muttered under your breath, "Though I hope not everything about me."

"Anyway, let's introduce you to the rest of the Avengers." Lance started.

1121.content:
"Don't think I'm stupid. That's impossible," Evan exclaimed in Misty's voice. "I can understand the science that can affect vocal waves," he added. Unbeknownst to Evan, he gave her a very Misty expression and stood as Misty often does to Ash when she doesn't believe him. "But there's nothing that somehow can "change" some part of me."

Evan then reached to take the necklace off when Melody placed one hand on the necklace as well and challenged, "Then there's no reason not to leave it on. You said I could pick your costume, and this is part of it. Besides, ..." She gave Evan a very coy little smirk then said, "Do you really want to sound like yourself while dressed like that?"

She had Evan there. He hadn't thought about his voice. He'd never hear the end of it if someone recognized him and it got back to any of the kids at school.

"Well, OK, I guess," Evan said then gave her a smile. Melody giggled at that but he didn't know that it was because he now not only looked like Misty, but sounded like her and was acting like her as well.

"Then we're all set. Shall we head to the con?"

As he started to follow her out, Evan felt quite different. Figuring it was just the costume, he ignored it. However, as they said goodbye to their parents and went out the door, their mom mumbled asking herself, "I wonder which of Melody's friends that was?"
